decks.notes: This UR Control deck aims to control the game through countering spells and removal, while utilizing cards like Snapcaster Mage and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student for value. It focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy with a mix of counterspells, burn spells, and bounce effects. The deck also includes a small amount of card advantage and selection with Preordain and Stern Dismissal. The mana base is designed to provide consistency and flexibility in casting spells, with the potential for powerful late-game plays with Hall of Storm Giants.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with key creature cards and then using instant reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance to cheat them into play. Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Buried Alive provide efficient ways to set up the combo, while cards like Faithful Mending and Solitude help control the board and protect the combo pieces. The deck aims to create explosive turns where powerful creatures like Griselbrand can come into play early and dominate the game. With a mix of disruption and combo potential, the deck can catch opponents off guard and win in a single turn.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers. By managing the opponent's threats and maintaining a board presence with cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Snapcaster Mage, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and eventually win the game with powerful finishers like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. The mana base provides consistent access to the deck's colors and allows for flexibility in casting spells of varying mana costs.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through powerful Eldrazi creatures and spells while using the UrzaTron lands to quickly ramp up mana. By utilizing cards like Devourer of Destiny and Thought-Knot Seer, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a strong board presence with high mana cost Eldrazi like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and World Breaker. Karn, the Great Creator provides additional utility and disruption, while cards like All Is Dust and Kozilek's Command help maintain board control. The deck's goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and spells before they can establish their own strategy.

The deck focuses on using powerful Eldrazi creatures to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck includes cards like Ancient Stirrings and Through the Breach to find and cheat out Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul and Ulamog. It also includes removal spells like Kozilek's Command and All Is Dust to deal with threats. The deck also utilizes lands like Eldrazi Temple and Grove of the Burnwillows to ramp into its big threats quickly. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big, hard-to-answer threats while controlling the board.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly assemble the Heliod Spike combo, using cards like Collected Company and Recruiter of the Guard to find key pieces like Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Spike Feeder. Utopia Sprawl and Arbor Elf help accelerate mana production, allowing for explosive turns. Walking Ballista provides another win condition by shooting opponents for lethal damage. The deck aims to gain infinite life with Heliod and Spike Feeder, creating an overwhelming advantage against aggressive opponents and setting up for a win through combat or direct damage with Ballista.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing powerful counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage engines such as Narset, Parter of Veils and The One Ring. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while gradually building up its own resources and eventually winning through incremental advantage. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler adds another layer of control and utility to the deck. The key strategy is to outvalue and outpace the opponent, while maintaining a strong grip on the game with the control elements provided by the deck.

This UR Control deck focuses on countering and controlling opponent's spells while using burn spells to remove threats. It also utilizes card draw and recursion with Snapcaster Mage and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The deck aims to control the board and ultimately win through efficient removal and control of the game. The deck includes a balance of counterspells, burn spells, and card advantage cards to maintain control throughout the game.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly through cards like Desperate Ritual and Ruby Medallion to cast spells like Glimpse the Impossible and Ral, Monsoon Mage in order to deal massive damage with cards like Grapeshot and Wish. The key strategy involves utilizing cards like Past in Flames and Reckless Impulse to recycle spells and continue the combo chain, overwhelming the opponent with a storm of spells and burn damage. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and win the game before they have a chance to respond.

The deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures to create a combo win condition. It utilizes cards like Nadu, Winged Wisdom, Springheart Nantuko, and Thassa's Oracle to generate value and win the game. The deck also includes cards like Sylvan Safekeeper and Boseiju, Who Endures to protect its combo pieces. Chord of Calling and Summoner's Pact are used to tutor for specific creatures when needed. The deck also includes disruption elements like Teferi, Time Raveler to control the game and ensure the combo goes off smoothly.

This deck focuses on utilizing The One Ring with various control elements to dominate the game. It features powerful cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Time Raveler to slow down the opponent and protect The One Ring. The deck also includes counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to maintain control of the game. With a mix of control elements and The One Ring's powerful abilities, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

This deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo using cards like Desperate Ritual, Pyretic Ritual, and Gifts Ungiven to generate mana and draw cards. Baral, Chief of Compliance and Ral, Monsoon Mage help reduce spell costs and increase spell efficiency. The win condition of the deck is using Grapeshot and Past in Flames to deal lethal damage to the opponent. By carefully sequencing spells and managing resources, the deck aims to quickly build up a storm count to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells.

This deck focuses on fast-paced aggression and burn spells to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. The deck includes low-cost creatures with haste, alongside powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart. The goal is to apply constant pressure on the opponent and finish them off before they can stabilize or gain momentum. The companion Jegantha, the Wellspring adds consistency and flexibility to the deck, allowing for a reliable source of mana and potentially extra power to close out games. Overall, this deck aims to win through swift and relentless attacks combined with direct damage spells.

The main idea behind this deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures such as Stoneforge Mystic and Giver of Runes, while disrupting their game plan with cards like Solitude and Field of Ruin. The deck also aims to control the board with cards like Ephemerate and Recruiter of the Guard. Finally, the deck utilizes equipment like Sword of Light and Shadow and Kaldra Compleat to provide additional value and close out the game quickly.
